summary: If services are not readily accessible at VA medical facilities, the Veterans Choice Program allows eligible veterans to receive care from non-VA providers. Congress created the temporary program in 2014, aiming to alleviate the excessive wait times some veterans faced at VA. However, we found that it’s unclear if the Choice Program improved the timeliness of veterans’ care because VA’s data are incomplete and unreliable...
title: Veterans Choice Program: Improvements Needed to Address Access-Related Challenges as VA Plans Consolidation of its Community Care Programs
